name: Step Sequencer Head
description: This algorithm shares the sequence of another Step Sequencer algorithm (above), and replicates the parameters that define how that sequence is played. This allows you to, for example, have the same sequence played in different directions simultaneously, or at different speeds, or with different transpositions. The Step Sequencer Head refers to the nearest Step Sequencer above it in the algorithm list. You can have as many Step Sequencer Heads as you like for each Step Sequencer.

parameters.name: Sequence
parameters.description: Selects the current sequence.

parameters.name: Start
parameters.description: The first step to play. A reset will jump to this step.

parameters.name: End
parameters.description: The last step to play.

parameters.name: Direction
parameters.description: The sequencer direction. See above.

parameters.name: Permutation
parameters.description: The sequencer permutation. See above.

parameters.name: Gate type
parameters.description: Sets the gate type: "% of clock" or "Trigger".

parameters.name: Gate length
parameters.description: Sets the length of the gate output if the type is "% of clock".

parameters.name: Trigger length
parameters.description: Sets the length of the gate output if the type is "Trigger".

parameters.name: Glide
parameters.description: Sets the glide time for tied notes.

parameters.name: Octave
parameters.description: Transposes the sequence in octaves.

parameters.name: Transpose
parameters.description: Transposes the sequence in semitones.

parameters.name: 1 100 10 ms Sets the length of the gate output if the type is "Trigger". Glide
parameters.description: Sets the glide time for tied notes.

parameters.name: 0 1 1 The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above, for the pitch CV output. Gate output
parameters.description: The bus to use for the gate output.

parameters.name: 0 1 1 The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above, for the velocity output. Mod output
parameters.description: The bus to use for the modulation CV output.

parameters.name: 0 1 1 The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above, for the modulation CV output. Step output
parameters.description: The bus to use for the step CV output. This

parameters.name: represents the current sequencer step number scaled as 1/12th of a Volt per step. Step output mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as

parameters.name: Follow MIDI clock
parameters.description: Sets whether the sequencer follows MIDI clock.

parameters.name: 1 100 10 ms Sets the length of the gate output if the type is "Trigger". Glide
parameters.description: Sets the glide time for tied notes.

parameters.name: 0 1 1 The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above, for the pitch CV output. Gate output
parameters.description: The bus to use for the gate output.

parameters.name: 0 1 1 The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above, for the velocity output. Mod output
parameters.description: The bus to use for the modulation CV output.

parameters.name: 0 1 1 The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above, for the modulation CV output. Sequence CV input
parameters.description: The bus to use to select the sequence. See above.

parameters.name: Divisor
parameters.description: Sets the clock divisor when following MIDI clock.

input_ports.name: Clock input
input_ports.description: The bus to use as the clock input.

input_ports.name: Reset input
input_ports.description: The bus to use as the reset input.

input_ports.name: Reset mode
input_ports.description: Sets the mode for the reset input. The options are: the input is a reset trigger, the input is a run/stop signal.

input_ports.name: Pitch output
input_ports.description: The bus to use for the pitch CV output.

input_ports.name: Pitch output mode
input_ports.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above, for the pitch CV output.

input_ports.name: Gate output
input_ports.description: The bus to use for the gate output.

input_ports.name: Gate output mode
input_ports.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above, for the gate output.

input_ports.name: Velocity output
input_ports.description: The bus to use for the velocity output.

input_ports.name: Velocity output mode
input_ports.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above, for the velocity output.

input_ports.name: Mod output
input_ports.description: The bus to use for the modulation CV output.

input_ports.name: Mod output mode
input_ports.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above, for the modulation CV output.

input_ports.name: Sequence CV input
input_ports.description: The bus to use to select the sequence. See above.

input_ports.name: Sequence trigger input
input_ports.description: The bus to use for the sequence select trigger. See above.
